question: Match the following external female genitalia terms with their NCERT-based descriptions:
column_II: Cushion of fatty tissue covered by skin and pubic hair
Fleshy folds of tissue surrounding the vaginal opening
Paired folds of tissue under the labia majora
Membrane partially covering the vaginal opening
Tiny finger-like structure above the urethral opening
matches: Mons pubis–Cushion of fatty tissue covered by skin and pubic hair
Labia majora–Fleshy folds of tissue surrounding the vaginal opening
Labia minora–Paired folds of tissue under the labia majora
Hymen–Membrane partially covering the vaginal opening
Clitoris–Tiny finger-like structure above the urethral opening

question: Match the following hymen-related facts with their NCERT-based descriptions:
column_I: One sport that can tear the hymen
column_II: May not affect the hymen in some women
Is not a reliable indicator of virginity
matches: Hymen may remain intact after–May not affect the hymen in some women
One sport that can tear the hymen–Horseback riding
Presence or absence of hymen–Is not a reliable indicator of virginity
Insertion of a vaginal tampon–Can tear the hymen
